Context:
Program Name: Computer Systems Technology
Code: T147
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,079.00
International Tuition: $17,880.00
Program Availability:
- Fall 2023: Closed for domestic and international students
- Winter 2024: Closed for domestic and international students
- Spring 2024: Not Available for both domestic and international students
Method of Study: Full-time
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Specializations: Networking, Systems
Specialization Courses: network security, voice-over-IP (VoIP), wireless LANs, mail server administration, content management systems (Collaboration), database administration, computer security, infrastructure virtualization (through the VMWare IT Academy), cloud computing.
* Please note that this program is also offered in a fully online format with code T187.

Context:
* The Computer Systems Technology program is a three-year online program with two optional specializations: Networking and Systems.
* The Networking specialization focuses on network security, VoIP, wireless LANs.
* The Systems specialization focuses on mail server administration, content management systems, database administration, and computer security.
* Both specializations include core courses on infrastructure virtualization through the VMWare IT Academy and cloud computing, along with best practices in Information Technology (IT).
* George Brown College invests in up-to-date networking, wireless, radio frequency, VoIP and security lab equipment for hands-on experience.
* In the third year, students are involved in real-life projects or case studies and have recently helped develop IT solutions for hospitals, large corporations, and major IT and telecommunications service providers.
* The program covers all courses of the official Cisco CCNA Routing & Switching curriculum and prepares students to write several other examinations leading to industry certifications, such as the Certified Wireless Network Administrator (CWNA) and Cisco Certified CyberOps Associate.
* Students who start in January will be required to attend classes during the summer months.
* The technology requirements for this program include a personal computer with at least 16 GB RAM, a minimum of 256 GB SSD hard drive (optimal: 500+ GB), a quad-core i7 2.4GHz processor or better, and a video card with a minimum of 2GB RAM/4GB recommended.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Computer Systems Technology Program T147 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The college requires a core i7 2.4GHz or better processor for admission. A video card with a minimum of 2GB RAM is recommended, with 4GB RAM being preferred. Students will need a webcam for their studies. The college offers career and postgraduate study opportunities, as well as educational pathways. Transfer credits can be received toward further study to attain a degree.

The curriculum planner for the 2023-2024 academic year is provided below:

Semester 1:
- COMP 1151: IT Essentials
- COMP 1236: Fundamentals of Computing Logic
- COMP 1234: Introduction To Web Development
- GSSC 1027: Personal Finance
- MATH 1162: Mathematics for Computer Technology I
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts

Semester 2:
- COMP 1176: Introduction to Networks
- COMP 3044: Linux Essentials
- COMP 1250: Introduction to Programming
- COMP 3105: Enterprise Desktop Operation Systems
- MATH 1172: Mathematics for Computer Technology II
- GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 3:
- COMP 3136: Network Infrastructure
- COMP 2064: Identity Management Services
- COMP 2155: Network Automation
- COMP 2148: Professional Workplace Competencies
- COMP 3066: Linux System Administration
- GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 4:
- COMP 3138: Enterprise Networking and Automation
- COMP 2102: Wireless Technology Fundamentals
- COMP 2141: Windows Server Network Infrastructure
- COMP 2156: DevOps For System Administration
- COMP 3061: Cyber Security Fundamentals

Students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000. This extra course is not counted as a required course for graduation and students will be charged for it. In semester five, students are to pick a specialization and register in the corresponding courses. One of the available specializations is Networking.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Computer Systems Technology Program T147 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the courses offered in Semester 5 and 6 of a computer science or related program at the college. Some of the courses mentioned are: COMP 3076 - Network Infrastructure Security, COMP 3112 - IP Telephony and Streaming Services, COMP 3115 - Information Systems Project Management, COMP 3102 - Mail Server Administration, COMP 3103 - Power Shell Scripting, COMP 3114 - Database Administration, COMP 3111 - Broadband and Data Communications, COMP 3125 - Cybersecurity Operations, COMP 3121 - System Data Collaboration, COMP 3098 - Enterprise Network and System Design, COMP 3093 - Infrastructure Virtualization, COMP 3094 - ITIL Foundation, COMP 3107 - Enterprise Network Management, COMP 3108 - Cloud Computing Infrastructure, COMP 3099 - Capstone Project.

The graduate of the program is expected to be able to identify, analyze, design, develop, implement, verify and document the requirements for a computing environment; diagnose, troubleshoot, document and monitor technical problems using appropriate methodologies and tools; analyze, design, implement and maintain secure computing environments; analyze, develop and maintain robust computing system solutions through validation testing and industry best practices; communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders to ensure effective working relationship; select and apply strategies for personal and professional development to enhance work performance; apply project management principles and tools when responding to requirements and monitoring projects within a computing environment; adhere to ethical, social media, legal, regulatory and economic requirements and/or principles in the development and management of the computing solutions and systems; investigate emerging trends to respond to technical challenges; analyze, plan, design, implement and administer computer systems and cloud solutions; research, design, deploy, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, upgrade and decommission computing system infrastructures.

The text does not provide any factual information about the name of the college or program offered, and no emails or names were mentioned in the text.

Context:
The text provides information on the following:

1. Program requirements: This includes tasks like decommissioning computing system infrastructures, automating routine tasks using scripting tools and programming languages, administering a database management system, and designing technical support processes that align with industry best practices.
2. Tuition fees:
   - Domestic tuition for programs starting in Fall 2022: $4,079.00
   - International tuition for programs starting in Fall 2023: $17,880.00
   - Fees are subject to change for later program starts
3. Financial Assistance: This program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet the eligibility criteria.
4. Admission Requirements:
   - Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
   - Grade 12 English (C or U)
   - Grade 11 Math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
   - Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math or upgrade to achieve required credits.
5. Course exemptions: College or university credits can be used for course exemptions. For more information, visit Transfer Guide.
6. International Students: Visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
7. How to Apply: Not specified in the text.
